intro: Antirrhinum molle var. oppositifolium, commonly known as the opposite-leaved snapdragon, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement. It produces vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
